page.title: 11ASHINGTON COLLIERY
page.content: Ashington mine was first developed in 1846 and known as 'Fell em Doon',the coal produced was used for landsale coal which was sold localy. In 1867 Bothal Pit opened and in 1873 Carl Pit then in 1867 Duke Pit. Later in 1896 there were 4 other Pits sunk just outside the Ashington area. Surface drift entrances for miners were driven at Bothal barns, Coney Garth and Blakemoore although outside the grid these locations were part of the Colliery complex. Most of the land in the grid was owned by the coal company to avoid paying compensation for land subsidence. Today in 1985, the colliery employs aproximately 600 men only, a drop from 4000 from earlier years. A great deal of the underground work is now mechanised, but the coal is rapidly being worked out limiting the collierys life.
